sentences.text:
The last NMU of beast made the package ship additional files, directly 
under /usr/share/mime/.

This is a packaging bug, because those files are 
meant to be managed by shared-mime-info triggers.

$ debdiff beast_0.7.1-5.1_i386.deb beast_0.7.1-5.2_i386.deb | head -n 11
[The following lists of changes regard files as different if they have
different names, permissions or owners.
On Sun, Jan 03, 2010 at 05:01:50PM +0100, Jakub Wilk wrote:

> The last NMU of beast made the package ship additional files,
> directly under /usr/share/mime/.

This is a packaging bug, because
> those files are meant to be managed by shared-mime-info triggers.

> $ debdiff beast_0.7.1-5.1_i386.deb beast_0.7.1-5.2_i386.deb | head -n 11
> [The following lists of changes regard files as different if they have
> different names, permissions or owners.

I was going to ask why this happened, given
that I routinely pipe my NMUs through debdiff before uploading, and here
is the answer:

$ debdiff beast_0.7.1-5.1+b1_amd64.deb beast_0.7.1-5.2_amd64.deb 
  File lists identical (after any substitutions)
, on amd64 there is no such file difference.
Still, the files are there in the .

deb and should indeed be removed; if
you can prepare a .
dsc I'll be happy to sponsor its upload, can you?
Otherwise please ping me and I'll do another NMU to fix this.

(Also, it would be nice to investigate why the files were not there in
the last i386 package, probably they got introduced by some change in
the toolchain and slipped in upon binNMUs?

>> $ debdiff beast_0.7.1-5.1_i386.deb beast_0.7.1-5.2_i386.deb | head -n 11
>> [The following lists of changes regard files as different if they have
>> different names, permissions or owners.

I was going to ask why this happened, given
>that I routinely pipe my NMUs through debdiff before uploading, and here
>is the answer:

>  $ debdiff beast_0.7.1-5.1+b1_amd64.deb beast_0.7.1-5.2_amd64.deb
>  File lists identical (after any substitutions)
, on amd64 there is no such file difference.

My fault, I forgot about the +b1 version! If fact this bug was 
introduced earlier, in the last binNMU:

$ debdiff beast_0.7.1-5.1_i386.deb beast_0.7.1-5.1+b1_i386.deb | head -n11
[The following lists of changes regard files as different if they have
different names, permissions or owners.

>(Also, it would be nice to investigate why the files were not there in
>the last i386 package, probably they got introduced by some change in
>the toolchain and slipped in upon binNMUs?

update-mime-database used to generate only the files that were being 
removed in debian/rules; now it generates a few more.
Here's the patch we have in Ubuntu.
* Remove use of update-mime-database during build (LP: #263417):
- remove manual deletion of /usr/share/mime created files from debian/rules
- removed shared-mime-info as a B-D from debian/control

+ remove calls to update-mime-database in data/Makefile.in
      + remove check for update-mime-database in configure

We believe that the bug you reported is fixed in the latest version of
beast, which is due to be installed in the Debian FTP archive:

A summary of the changes between this version and the previous one is
attached.
Thank you for reporting the bug, which will now be closed.

If you
have further comments please address them to 563524@bugs.debian.org,
and the maintainer will reopen the bug report if appropriate.
Alessio Treglia <alessio@debian.org> (supplier of updated beast package)

(This message was generated automatically at their request; if you
believe that there is a problem with it please contact the archive
administrators by mailing ftpmaster@debian.org)
Binary: beast bse-alsa libbse-0.7-4 libbse-dev beast-doc

Maintainer: Debian Multimedia Maintainers <pkg-multimedia-maintainers@lists.alioth.debian.org>
Changed-By: Alessio Treglia <alessio@debian.org>
beast      - music synthesis and composition framework

libbse-0.7-4 - music synthesis and composition framework - shared library
 libbse-dev - music synthesis and composition framework - development files
Closes: 563524 564799 621234 625854

* Taking this under Debian Multimedia Maintainers's umbrella,
     ACK'd by Sam Hocevar (Closes: #564799):
- Move Sam to the Uploaders field.
- Add myself to the Uploaders field.
- Move packaging to git, update VCS-* tags properly.
* Acknowledge NMU: 0.7.1-5.2: thanks to Stefano Zacchiroli for the good job.
* Acknowledge NMU: 0.7.1-5.1: thanks to Chris Lamb for the good job.

+ Renamed the project to Better Audio System / Better Sound Engine
       + Moved project website to: http://beast.testbit.eu/

+ Fixed subnormal tests on AMD64 if SSE unit is in DAZ mode
       + Replaced slow resampler checks with a much faster resampling test
       + Performance improvements for various tests
+ Speed improvements for record field name
+ Fixed XRUNs in ALSA driver on 64bit systems

+ Moved Beast/BSE to GNU LGPL, use AS-IS license for examples
       + Module changes and additions:
DavXTalStrings - Use deterministic random numbers for unit tests.

+ Error bell can be muted in beast preferences dialog
       + Added multisample creation/editing command line tool: bsewavetool
       + Support adjustable volume, pitching and drum envelopes in .

bsewave files
       + Added Retro Acoustic drum kit

+ Added support for loading 32bit and 24bit PCM-format WAV files
       + Added support for gcc-4.4 and automake-1.10

+ Added support for guile-1.8, guile-1.6 remains as minimum requirement
       + Various fixes, improvements and much improved test coverage.
+ Migrated translation support to use awk, sed and po/Makefile.am.
* Switch to DH7 pure form, 3.0 (quilt) format.
- libbse-dev to provide the development files.
- bse-alsa to provide the plugin for ALSA:
+ Replacement for the current bse-alsa built from bse.
- Remove unneeded Conflicts on cmt << 1.15, current stable has cmt 1.16
- Add Suggests: beast-doc to beast's and libbse-dev's stanzas.
- Don't pass unrecognized options to configure, add --enable-debug=yes.
- Don't install install symlinks by hand, use dh_link.
- Exclude plugins,alsa-driver from being treated as shared libraries.

- Remove manual deletion of /usr/share/mime created files;
       thanks to Ilya Barygin (Closes: #563524).
- Don't remove data/beast-audio-x-bse.png in the clean target.
- Install NEWS file as upstream changelog.
- The sources have been relicensed to LGPL.
- Rewrite as per DEP-5 spec proposal.
* Add patch to fix FTBFS with GCC4.5.
* Add patch to remove Encoding field from the desktop file.
